instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light when battery plugged in
threads.message: 820-00165 no green light when battery plugged in, when battery unplugged board works fine , will not work from the battery only , somehow i have 19v on R7006 even with D7005 removed which means somehow the charger voltage is going directly to the battery ??? , i cant see on the schematic where these two voltage lines may short together if D7005 is removed

threads.title: 820-00165 no green light when battery plugged in
threads.message:
Change Q7130.
Its high-side part is shorted...

Be sure C7125 is good.
